title: Tyson Fury speaks out on WWE brawl and sends warning to Braun Strowman
text:
Tyson Fury says he was ‘insulted’ by WWE star Braun Strowman (Picture: Getty)

Tyson Fury has spoken out after attempting to enter the ring at WWE SmackDown and issued a warning to ‘big dosser’ Braun Strowman.

Former heavyweight champion Fury says he was ‘insulted’ by Strowman as he and his family attended the WWE event at the Staples Center in Los Angeles on Friday night.

Fury, 31, and Strowman exchanged words and the Brit attempted to enter the ring only to be restrained by a number of security guards.

Breaking his silence on the incident, Fury said: ‘Last night we attended WWE Smackdown for my son’s birthday. I’m a lifelong WWE fan and my son loves it.

TYSON FURY!! ARE YOU SERIOUS?! After hopping the guardrail last night on #SmackDown in an attempt to confront @BraunStrowman, the always controversial @Tyson_Fury will now be offered an open forum this Monday night on #Raw to speak his mind! pic.twitter.com/n3oXPukxMr — WWE UK (@WWEUK) October 5, 2019

‘We went there for his birthday and I was insulted in front of my family [by] Braun Strowman. It got a bit heated and we saw what happened.

‘I’ve been invited to Monday Night Raw, I accept. I’ll be there.

‘But if Braun Strowman doesn’t behave himself, he’ll get some of these hands, the big dosser.’

Fury’s family then chanted ‘you big dosser’ as they took a dig at Strowman.
